intro: Pouteria kaieteurensis, commonly known as the Kaieteure pouteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Guyana and Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into edible fruits. The fruit has a thick, fibrous peel and a sweet, creamy pulp, making it a valuable resource in local ecosystems. It plays an important role in the biodiversity of its native habitat and is often found in lowland rainforests.
